eos Minarets_California are a series of jagged peaks in the Sierra Nevada Mountains of the state of California in the southwestern United States . Collectively ,
eos Minarets_California are a series of jagged peaks in the Sierra Nevada Mountains of the state of California in the southwestern United States . Collectively , Minarets_California form an arête and Minarets_California are a prominent feature in the Ansel Adams Wilderness .
eos Collectively , Minarets_California form an arête and Minarets_California are a prominent feature in the Ansel Adams Wilderness . Minarets_California were named by the California Geographical Survey in 1868 , which reported : ` ` To the south of Mount Ritter are some grand pinnacles of granite , very lofty and apparently inaccessible , to which we gave the name of ` the Minarets . ' '' Seventeen of
eos Seventeen of Minarets_California have been given unofficial names , including Michael Minaret , Adams Minaret , Leonard Minaret , and Clyde Minaret . Walter A Starr , Jr. , author of Starr 's Guide to the John Muir Trail and the High Sierra Region , fell to his death while solo - climbing Michael Minaret in 1933 . Until 1984 , the Ansel Adams Wilderness was named the Minaret Wilderness after

eos ( German : ` ` monk '' ) is a mountain in the Swiss Alps . Together with the Eiger and the Jungfrau Moench forms a salient tripartite group visible from far away .

eos Molamenqing topographic prominence , ie Molamenqing rise above the saddle connecting Molamenqing with Shishapangma , is only 430 metres , which is relatively small for a Himalayan peak , although large enough for Molamenqing to qualify in some reckonings as an independent peak . eos Molamenqing did enjoy a temporary fame in the early 1980 's . At the time Molamenqing was one of the highest unclimbed peaks in the world ( using a prominence cutoff low enough to qualify Molamenqing as a separate summit ) . A team from New Zealand applied to the Chinese authorities to climb
eos At the time Molamenqing was one of the highest unclimbed peaks in the world ( using a prominence cutoff low enough to qualify Molamenqing as a separate summit ) . eos ( Italian for white mountain ) or Mont Blanc ( French , same meaning ) also known as ` ` La Dame Blanche '' ( French , the white lady ) is a mountain in the Alps . With Mont_Blanc 4,808 m summit , Mont_Blanc is the highest mountain in the Alps and Western Europe .
eos Mont_Blanc lies between the regions of Aosta Valley , Italy , and Haute - Savoie , France . The location of the summit itself is a subject of controversy between the two countries , as each tends to place it within its own boundaries on maps . eos Ventor in classical norm or Ventour in Mistralian norm ) is a mountain in the Provence region of southern France , located some 20 km north - east of Carpentras , Vaucluse . On the north - side , Mont_Ventoux borders the Drôme département .
eos Mont_Ventoux is the largest mountain in the region and Mont_Ventoux has been nicknamed the ` ` Giant of Provence '' , or ` ` The Bald Mountain '' . As the name might suggest ( venteux means windy in French ) , it can get windy at the summit , especially with the mistral ; windspeeds as high as 320 km / h ( 193 mph ) have been recorded . The road over
eos As the name might suggest ( venteux means windy in French ) , it can get windy at the summit , especially with the mistral ; windspeeds as high as 320 km / h ( 193 mph ) have been recorded . The road over Mont_Ventoux is often closed due to high winds . The real origins of the name are thought to trace back to the 1st or 2nd century AD , when
eos The real origins of the name are thought to trace back to the 1st or 2nd century AD , when Mont_Ventoux was named ` Vintur ' after a Gaulish god of the summits , or ` Ven - Top ' , meaning ` ` snowy peak '' in the ancient Gallic language . In the 10th century , the names Mons Ventosus and Mons Ventorius appear .
eos In the 10th century , the names Mons Ventosus and Mons Ventorius appear . Mont_Ventoux , although geologically part of the Alps , is often considered to be separate from them , due to the lack of mountains of a similar height nearby .

eos ( Mont Perdu in French , both meaning lost mountain ) is the third highest mountain in the Pyrenees . The summit of Monte_Perdido ( 3355 m ) , located in Spain , lies hidden from France by the seemingly impenetrable peaks of the Cirques of Gavarnie and Estaube . To get to
eos To get to Monte_Perdido from Spain is easier . Explorers first had to hike from the Aragonese village of Torla along the huge Ordesa Valley and then up through the Circo de Soaso before attempting the stiff climb to the summit .

eos Monte_Pissis is the third highest in the Western Hemisphere , and Monte_Pissis is located about 550 km north of Aconcagua . Due to Monte_Pissis location in the Atacama Desert , Monte_Pissis has very dry conditions with snow only remaining on the peak during winter .

eos Monte_Pissis is very high and remote , however the ascent is but a hike , albeit a long one . In 1994 it was claimed by Argentine authorities that an advanced GPS survey had determined that the elevation of Monte_Pissis was 6,882 m , and higher than Ojos del Salado , but SRTM data and several modern GPS surveys have proved that this widely reproduced and repeated claim is incorrect . eos In 1994 it was claimed by Argentine authorities that an advanced GPS survey had determined that the elevation of Monte_Pissis was 6,882 m , and higher than Ojos del Salado , but SRTM data and several modern GPS surveys have proved that this widely reproduced and repeated claim is incorrect . In 2007 , a Chilean - European expedition performed a precise survey on both Ojos del Salado and Monte_Pissis , using more accurate instruments . eos Monte_Roraima ( known as Cerro Roraima in Spanish , Monte Roraima in Portuguese ) , with a peak at 2,810 metres ( 8986 feet ) , is the highest of Venezuela 's distinctive table - top mountains , known as tepuis . Monte_Roraima marks the border between Venezuela , Brazil and Guyana , although more than three quarters of Monte_Roraima is in Venezuelan territory .
eos Monte_Roraima is the highset mountain in Guyana , but Venezuela and Brazil have higher mountains . The triple border point on the summit is at 5 ° 12 ' 08N , 60 ° 44 ' 07W .
eos Monte_Roraima lies on the Guiana Shield in the southeastern corner of Venezuela 's 30,000 km ² Canaima National Park , which is roughly located in the Gran Sabana region . eos Monte_Roraima lies on the Guiana Shield in the southeastern corner of Venezuela 's 30,000 km ² Canaima National Park , which is roughly located in the Gran Sabana region . eos Mount_Adams_New_Hampshire is the second highest mountain in New Hampshire , after Mt. Washington ( 6,288 ft ) , and Mount_Adams_New_Hampshire is the highest peak in the northeast United States which does not have an auto road to the summit . Located in the Northern Presidential Range ,
eos Mount_Adams_New_Hampshire is the second highest mountain in New Hampshire , after Mt. Washington ( 6,288 ft ) , and Mount_Adams_New_Hampshire is the highest peak in the northeast United States which does not have an auto road to the summit . Located in the Northern Presidential Range , Mount_Adams_New_Hampshire was named after John Adams , the second president of the United States .
eos Mount_Adams_New_Hampshire was given this name on july 31 , 1820 . To the north and east is Mount Madison and to the south and west is Mount Jefferson . There are two major subsidiary peaks of
eos There are two major subsidiary peaks of Mount_Adams_New_Hampshire : Mount Sam Adams and Mount Quincy Adams , named after John Adams ' cousin , Revolutionary leader Samuel Adams , and son , President John Quincy Adams , respectively . These peaks along with the two other sub - peaks , Adams 4 and Adams 5 are collectively referred to as the ` ` Adams Family '' of peaks . eos The northern side of the mountain ridge is located in Low and Burbank 's Grant , and the end of Durand Ridge , and King Ravine , on the north side of Mount_Adams_New_Hampshire are in the town of Randolph ( formerly Durand ) . eos The entire south side of the mountain ridge is in Thompson and Meserve 's Purchase . The Appalachian Trail traverses the col between Mount_Adams_New_Hampshire and Mount Sam Adams , on a path called ` ` Gulfside Trail . eos Mount_Aspiring is New Zealand 's highest mountain outside the Mount Cook region . Set within the South Island 's Mount Aspiring National Park ,
eos Mount_Aspiring is New Zealand 's highest mountain outside the Mount Cook region . Set within the South Island 's Mount Aspiring National Park , Mount_Aspiring has a height of 3,033 metres . Māori named
eos Māori named Mount_Aspiring Tititea , which translates as Glistening Peak . Named in december 1857 by the Chief Surveyor for the Otago Province , John Turnbull Thompson .
eos Mount_Aspiring lies at the junction of three major glacial systems - the Bonar Glacier , which drains into the Waipara River , and the Volta and Therma Glaciers , which both drain into the Waitoto River . The Waipara is a tributary of the Arawhata River , and both the Arawhata and Waitoto Rivers flow out to the west coast in between Haast and Jackson Bay .

eos Mount_Baker ( elevation 10,778 feet , 3,285 m ) is a glaciated andesitic stratovolcano in the Cascade Volcanic Arc and the Cascades of Washington State in the United States about due east of the city of Bellingham , Whatcom County .
eos Mount_Baker ( elevation 10,778 feet , 3,285 m ) is a glaciated andesitic stratovolcano in the Cascade Volcanic Arc and the Cascades of Washington State in the United States about due east of the city of Bellingham , Whatcom County . Mount_Baker is also easily visible from much of Greater Victoria , Greater Vancouver and the Fraser Valley just across the Canadian border to the north , and especially from the communities of Mission and Abbotsford , both about 28 mi east of Vancouver , BC - as well as from some locations in Everett and even Seattle to the southwest . eos Mount_Baker is also easily visible from much of Greater Victoria , Greater Vancouver and the Fraser Valley just across the Canadian border to the north , and especially from the communities of Mission and Abbotsford , both about 28 mi east of Vancouver , BC - as well as from some locations in Everett and even Seattle to the southwest . eos Local Native Americans call Mount_Baker ` ` Koma Kulshan , '' but the explorer George Vancouver named Mount_Baker for 3rd Lieutenant Joseph Baker of the HMS Discovery , who on april 30 , 1792 became the first European to see Mount_Baker . After Mount Rainier , Mount_Baker is the most heavily glaciated of the Cascade volcanoes : the volume of snow and ice on Mount_Baker ( 0.43 cubic miles , 1.8 cubic kilometers ) is greater than that of all the other Cascades volcanoes ( except Rainier ) combined .

eos Mount_Berlin is the sixth highest volcano in Antarctica , located 16 km west of Mount Moulton in Marie Byrd Land near the eastern coast of the Ross Sea .
eos The volcanic structure is considered active , as steaming fumaroles have been observed near the rim of the northern and western calderas , producing fumarolic ice towers . eos Mount_Bona is one of the major mountains of the Saint Elias Mountains in eastern Alaska , and Mount_Bona is the fifth highest independent peak in the United States .

eos Mount_Bona is one of the major mountains of the Saint Elias Mountains in eastern Alaska , and Mount_Bona is the fifth highest independent peak in the United States . Mount_Bona and Mount_Bona adjacent neighbor Mount Churchill are both large ice - covered stratovolcanoes .
eos Mount_Bona and Mount_Bona adjacent neighbor Mount Churchill are both large ice - covered stratovolcanoes . Mount_Bona has the distinction of being the highest volcano in the United States and the fourth highest in North America , outranked only by the three highest Mexican volcanoes , Pico de Orizaba , Popocatépetl , and Iztaccíhuatl .
eos Mount_Bona has the distinction of being the highest volcano in the United States and the fourth highest in North America , outranked only by the three highest Mexican volcanoes , Pico de Orizaba , Popocatépetl , and Iztaccíhuatl . Mount_Bona massif is covered almost entirely by icefields and glaciers , and it is the principal source of ice for the Klutlan Glacier , which flows east for over 40 mi into the Yukon Territory of Canada .
eos Mount_Bona massif is covered almost entirely by icefields and glaciers , and it is the principal source of ice for the Klutlan Glacier , which flows east for over 40 mi into the Yukon Territory of Canada . Mount_Bona also contributes a large volume of ice to the north - flowing Russell Glacier system .
eos Mount_Bona also contributes a large volume of ice to the north - flowing Russell Glacier system . Mount_Bona was named by Prince Luigi Amedeo , Duke of the Abruzzi in 1897 , who saw the peak while making the first ascent of Mount Saint Elias about 80 miles ( 130 km ) to the southeast . He named
eos Mount_Bona was named by Prince Luigi Amedeo , Duke of the Abruzzi in 1897 , who saw the peak while making the first ascent of Mount Saint Elias about 80 miles ( 130 km ) to the southeast . He named Mount_Bona after the Bona , his racing yacht .

eos Mount_Carleton , in Mount Carleton Provincial Park , is the highest elevation in the Canadian province of New Brunswick , and Mount_Carleton is also the highest peak in the Canadian Maritime Provinces .
eos Mount_Carleton , in Mount Carleton Provincial Park , is the highest elevation in the Canadian province of New Brunswick , and Mount_Carleton is also the highest peak in the Canadian Maritime Provinces . Mount_Carleton is one of the highlights of the Canadian portion of the International Appalachian Trail .
eos A very similar hut was maintained on Big Bald Mountain . Triangulation among these huts and other fire towers allowed the locations of wildfires to be determined quickly and easily .
eos Triangulation among these huts and other fire towers allowed the locations of wildfires to be determined quickly and easily . Mount_Carleton is a monadnock , an erosional remnant of resistant igneous rocks that remained after an ancient Mesozoic peneplain surface was uplifted in the Cenozoic to form a plateau , and subsequently dissected via millions of years of erosion by wind , water and glacial ice .

eos Mount_Caubvick ( known as Mont D'Iberville in Quebec ) is a mountain located on the border between Labrador and Quebec in the Selamiut Range of the Torngat Mountains . Mount_Caubvick is the highest point in mainland Canada east of Alberta .

eos Mount_Damavand is also the highest volcano in all of Asia . Though not volcanically active , there are fumaroles near the summit crater that deposit sulfur , which were most recently known to be active on july 6 , 2007 .

eos Mount_Diablo is a mountain in Contra Costa County , California in the San Francisco Bay Area , located south of the town of Clayton and northeast of Danville . Mount_Diablo is an isolated 3,849-foot ( 1,173 m ) upthrust peak Mount_Diablo is visible from most of the San Francisco Bay Area and much of northern California .
eos Mount_Diablo is an isolated 3,849-foot ( 1,173 m ) upthrust peak Mount_Diablo is visible from most of the San Francisco Bay Area and much of northern California . Mount_Diablo appears from many angles to be a double pyramid and Mount_Diablo includes many subsidiary peaks , the largest and closest of which is the other half of the double pyramid , North Peak , nearly as high in elevation at 3,557 feet ( 1,084 m ) .
eos Mount_Diablo is the centerpiece of Mount Diablo State Park , a state park of approximately 20,000 acres ( 80 km ² ) in area . The park was the first public open space of a complex - according to Save Mount Diablo - now including 38 preserves , including adjacent and nearby city open spaces , regional parks , watersheds , etc . , buffered in some areas with private lands protected with conservation easements . eos Mount_Elbrus ( Russian : Эльбрус ) is a peak located in the western Caucasus mountains , in Kabardino - Balkaria and Karachay - Cherkessia , Russia , near the border of Georgia . A stratovolcano that has lain dormant for about 2,000 years , Mount_Elbrus is the highest mountain in the Caucasus which belongs to Europe ( if the border between Europe and Asia is considered to be at the watershed divide of the Caucasus , or anywhere south of this ) .
eos Mount_Elbrus ( Russian : Эльбрус ) is a peak located in the western Caucasus mountains , in Kabardino - Balkaria and Karachay - Cherkessia , Russia , near the border of Georgia . A stratovolcano that has lain dormant for about 2,000 years , Mount_Elbrus is the highest mountain in the Caucasus which belongs to Europe ( if the border between Europe and Asia is considered to be at the watershed divide of the Caucasus , or anywhere south of this ) . eos Mount_Evans is a mountain in the Front Range region of the Rocky Mountains , in Clear Creek County , Colorado .
eos Mount_Evans is a mountain in the Front Range region of the Rocky Mountains , in Clear Creek County , Colorado . Mount_Evans is one of 54 fourteeners ( mountains with peaks over 14,000 feet ) in Colorado , and the closest fourteener to Denver .
eos Mount_Evans is a mountain in the Front Range region of the Rocky Mountains , in Clear Creek County , Colorado . Mount_Evans is often compared to Pikes Peak - another Front Range fourteener - which
eos Mount_Evans is one of 54 fourteeners ( mountains with peaks over 14,000 feet ) in Colorado , and the closest fourteener to Denver . Mount_Evans is often compared to Pikes Peak - another Front Range fourteener - which Mount_Evans exceeds in elevation by 154 ft ( 50 m ) .
eos Mount_Evans is often compared to Pikes Peak - another Front Range fourteener - which Mount_Evans exceeds in elevation by 154 ft ( 50 m ) . Mount_Evans was originally known as Mount Rosa or Mount Rosalie ( named for the wife of Fitz Hugh Ludlow who would later be the wife of Albert Bierstadt , and featured in Bierstadt 's painting ` ` Storm in the Rocky Mountains '' ) , and Mount_Evans is located in what is known by locals as the Chicago Peaks Range .
eos Mount_Evans was originally known as Mount Rosa or Mount Rosalie ( named for the wife of Fitz Hugh Ludlow who would later be the wife of Albert Bierstadt , and featured in Bierstadt 's painting ` ` Storm in the Rocky Mountains '' ) , and Mount_Evans is located in what is known by locals as the Chicago Peaks Range . Mount_Evans is believed to have been climbed first in 1872 by Judge Lunt and a friend , but many accounts point to Albert Bierstadt as the first ascender in 1863 . In 1895 , Colorado 's legislature officially renamed
eos Mount_Evans is believed to have been climbed first in 1872 by Judge Lunt and a friend , but many accounts point to Albert Bierstadt as the first ascender in 1863 . In 1895 , Colorado 's legislature officially renamed Mount_Evans in honor of John Evans , second governor of the Colorado Territory from 1862 to 1865 .
eos In 1895 , Colorado 's legislature officially renamed Mount_Evans in honor of John Evans , second governor of the Colorado Territory from 1862 to 1865 . Mount_Evans is one of the characteristic Front Range peaks , dominating the western skyline of the Great Plains along with Pikes Peak and nearby Mount Bierstadt . In the early days of Colorado tourism ,
eos Mount_Evans is one of the characteristic Front Range peaks , dominating the western skyline of the Great Plains along with Pikes Peak and nearby Mount Bierstadt . In the early days of Colorado tourism , Mount_Evans and Denver were often in competition with Pikes Peak and Colorado Springs . eos As of 2006 , the Mount Evans Scenic Byway , leading to the summit overlook , is the highest paved road in North America . The byway has made Mount_Evans a very accessible peak to all varieties of tourists and mountaineers .

eos Mount_Fairweather ( officially known as Fairweather Mountain in Canada but referred to also as Fairweather nonetheless ) is a mountain located 20 km ( 14 mi ) east of the Pacific Ocean in Glacier Bay National Park of the United States . While the majority of Mount_Fairweather lies within the City and Borough of Yakutat , Alaska , the actual summit is in Tatshenshini - Alsek Park in British Columbia , making it the highest point in that province .

Mount_Fairweather was named on May 3 , 1778 by Captain James Cook , apparently for the good weather encountered at the time .

eos Mount_Kerinci ( also spelled Kerintji , among several other ways , and referred to as Gunung Kerinci , Gadang , Berapi Kurinci , Kerinchi , Korinci , or Peak of Indrapura as well ) is the highest volcano in Indonesia , and the highest peak in Sumatra .
eos Mount_Kerinci ( also spelled Kerintji , among several other ways , and referred to as Gunung Kerinci , Gadang , Berapi Kurinci , Kerinchi , Korinci , or Peak of Indrapura as well ) is the highest volcano in Indonesia , and the highest peak in Sumatra . Mount_Kerinci is located in Province of Jambi , the west central part of the island , in the Pegunungan / Bukit Barisan , near the west coast , and Mount_Kerinci is about 130 km south of Padang .
eos Mount_Kerinci is the most prominent feature of the terrain of Kerinci Seblat National Park , with pine - forested slopes rising 2,400 - 3,300 metres above the surrounding basin , and a cone 13 km wide and 25 km long at the base , elongated in the north - south direction . At the summit there is a deep 600 m wide crater , often partially filled with green - yellow water .
eos At the summit there is a deep 600 m wide crater , often partially filled with green - yellow water . Mount_Kerinci is more active than most Indonesian volcanoes , with nearly annual phreatic eruptions .
eos Mount_Kerinci is more active than most Indonesian volcanoes , with nearly annual phreatic eruptions . Mount_Kerinci last erupted in 2004 , and Mount_Kerinci continues to spew clouds of sulphurous smoke , with plumes reaching as high as 1000 m above the summit . While there is farmland in the area , and a tea plantation on Mount_Kerinci southern slope , Mount_Kerinci , being located in an Indonesian national park , and perhaps out of respect for

eos Mount_Kinabalu ( Malay : Gunung Kinabalu ) is a prominent mountain in Southeast Asia .
eos ( Malay : Gunung Kinabalu ) is a prominent mountain in Southeast Asia . Mount_Kinabalu is located in Kinabalu National Park ( a World Heritage Site ) in the east Malaysian state of Sabah , which is on the island of Borneo in the tropics . In 1997 , a re - survey using satellite technology established
eos Mount_Kinabalu is located in Kinabalu National Park ( a World Heritage Site ) in the east Malaysian state of Sabah , which is on the island of Borneo in the tropics . In 1997 , a re - survey using satellite technology established Mount_Kinabalu summit ( known as Low 's Peak ) height at 4095 m above sea level , which is some less than the previously thought and hitherto published figure of 4,101 metres ( 13,455 ft ) .
eos In 1997 , a re - survey using satellite technology established Mount_Kinabalu summit ( known as Low 's Peak ) height at 4095 m above sea level , which is some less than the previously thought and hitherto published figure of 4,101 metres ( 13,455 ft ) . Mount_Kinabalu is the fourth tallest in Southeast Asia behind Hkakabo Razi of Myanmar ( 5881 meter ) , Puncak Jaya ( 4884 meter ) and Puncak Trikora ( 4750 meter ) of Papua , Indonesia , and Mount_Kinabalu is therefore also the tallest in Malaysia and on the island of Borneo , which Malaysia shares with Indonesia and Brunei .

eos Mount_Kosciuszko , located in the Snowy Mountains , in Kosciuszko National Park , is the highest mountain in Australia ( not including its external territories ) , at 2,228 m above sea level . Mount_Kosciuszko was named by the Polish explorer Count Paul Strzelecki in 1840 , in honour of the Polish national hero General Tadeusz Kościuszko , because of Mount_Kosciuszko perceived resemblance to the Kościuszko Mound in Krakow . The name of
eos The name of Mount_Kosciuszko was formerly spelled ` ` Mount Kosciusko , '' an Anglicisation ; but the version ` ` Mount Kosciuszko '' was officially adopted in 1997 by the Geographical Names Board of NSW . eos Mount_Lafayette is one of the most popular day - hike destinations in the White Mountain National Forest due to spectacular views at Mount_Lafayette summit and Mount_Lafayette location beside Interstate 93 . The upper portion of Mount_Lafayette is located in the Alpine Zone , an area of little vegetation characterized by rock fields and harsh weather . eos When the mistake was realized , Mount_Langley was alternately called Mount Corcoran , Cirque Peak , or Sheep Mountain ; the former two names being later attached to other mountains . But Mount_Langley current name became established in local usage , and was made official by the USGS .

eos Mount_Lefroy is a mountain on the Continental Divide , at the border of Alberta and British Columbia in western Canada .
eos Mount_Lefroy is a mountain on the Continental Divide , at the border of Alberta and British Columbia in western Canada . Mount_Lefroy resides on the eastern side of Abbot Pass .
eos Mount_Lefroy resides on the eastern side of Abbot Pass . Mount_Lefroy was named by George M Dawson in 1894 for Sir John Henry Lefroy ( 1817 - 1890 ) , an astronomer who had traveled over 8800 km in Canada 's north between 1842 - 44 making meteorological and magnetic observations .

eos Mount_Lemmon was named in honor of botanist Sarah Lemmon , who trekked to the top of Mount_Lemmon with Native American guides by mule and foot in 1881 . Her husband , John Gill Lemmon , an invalid , remained at the base of Mount_Lemmon . A small town called Summerhaven is on
eos It is near Ski Valley which is the southernmost ski destination in the continental United States . It is the site of an observatory , which was formerly the site of a radar base of the Air Defense Command , and the building that formerly housed a military emergency radar tracking station for landing the Space Shuttle at White Sands Missile Range . eos It is the site of an observatory , which was formerly the site of a radar base of the Air Defense Command , and the building that formerly housed a military emergency radar tracking station for landing the Space Shuttle at White Sands Missile Range . Although the United States Military had a presence on Mount_Lemmon for several decades all their facilities have been abandoned . The telescopes on
eos The telescopes on Mount_Lemmon are still used for astronomical research today by organizations such as the Catalina Sky Survey , although the most frequent users are participants in the University of Arizona Astronomy Camp program . The location ` Windy Point ' was built by the Federal Bureau of Prisons , using a large number of prisoners over a period of 18 years , and is a popular place for outdoor weddings . There is also an isolated population of American Red Squirrels on
eos There is also an isolated population of American Red Squirrels on Mount_Lemmon , which have been the focus of a number of environmental concerns , and have restricted development . eos The beautiful , curving road is a favorite drive for tourists , for locals escaping summer 's heat , for motorcyclists , and cyclists . The highway has been improved recently , but the speed limit has also been lowered to 35 MPH ( 56 km / h ) due to concerns about the highway 's safety during peak traffic times . eos Mount_Lowe_California is a mountain on the southern fold of the San Gabriel Mountains . Originally named Oak Mountain ,
eos Mount_Lowe_California is a mountain on the southern fold of the San Gabriel Mountains . Originally named Oak Mountain , Mount_Lowe_California was renamed for Professor Thaddeus SC Lowe , who is credited for being the first white man to set foot on and plant the American flag at
eos Mount_Lowe_California is a mountain on the southern fold of the San Gabriel Mountains . Originally named Oak Mountain , Mount_Lowe_California was renamed for Professor Thaddeus SC Lowe , who is credited for being the first white man to set foot on and plant the American flag at Mount_Lowe_California peak , and who built the Mount Lowe Railway to
eos Originally named Oak Mountain , Mount_Lowe_California was renamed for Professor Thaddeus SC Lowe , who is credited for being the first white man to set foot on and plant the American flag at Mount_Lowe_California peak , and who built the Mount Lowe Railway to Mount_Lowe_California foot in 1896 . The record of the naming was made official by Andrew McNally , the famous Chicago map printer and summertime resident of Altadena , who promised to print ` ` Mount Lowe '' on all his maps .
eos The record of the naming was made official by Andrew McNally , the famous Chicago map printer and summertime resident of Altadena , who promised to print ` ` Mount Lowe '' on all his maps . Mount_Lowe_California was established as an alternate route for the Mount Lowe Railway when attempts to procure rights of way to the more prominent Mount Wilson had failed . A number of trails stem from
eos Mount_Lowe_California was established as an alternate route for the Mount Lowe Railway when attempts to procure rights of way to the more prominent Mount Wilson had failed . A number of trails stem from Mount_Lowe_California due to the Mount Lowe Tavern which was built at Crystal Springs below the summit and operated from 1895 - 1936 . One of the historic trails was the ` ` Mount Lowe Eight '' which was a mule ride attraction of the hotel that made a figure eight shaped route starting at the Tavern , ascending the summit of
eos One of the historic trails was the ` ` Mount Lowe Eight '' which was a mule ride attraction of the hotel that made a figure eight shaped route starting at the Tavern , ascending the summit of Mount_Lowe_California , returning to the Tavern , and crisscrossing to a trail that headed down Castle Canyon . From there the trail passed down to the Echo Mountain resort and ascended on the return to the Tavern .

eos Mount_Lucania is the third highest mountain in Canada . A long ridge connects Mount_Lucania with Mount Steele ( 5,073 m ) , the fifth highest in Canada .

eos The ski - equipped Fairchild F-51 made several trips to the landing site on the glacier without event in May , but on landing with Washburn and Bates in june , the plane sank into unseasonal slush . Washburn , Bates and Reeve pressed hard for five days to get the airplane out and Reeve was eventually able to get the airplane airborne with all excess weight removed and with the assistance of a smooth icefall with a steep drop . Washburn and Bates continued on foot to make the first ascent of

Washburn and Bates continued on foot to make the first ascent of Mount_Lucania , and after an epic descent and journey to civilization , they hiked over 150 miles through the wilderness to safety in the small town of Burwash Landing in the Yukon . eos Mount_Marcus_Baker was originally called ` ` Mount Saint Agnes '' ; according to Bradford Washburn , James W Bagley of the USGS named Mount_Marcus_Baker after his wife Agnes , adding the ` ` Saint '' in hopes of making the name stick . eos Mount_Merapi , Gunung Merapi in Indonesian language , is a conical volcano located on the border between Central Java and Yogyakarta , Indonesia .
eos Mount_Merapi , Gunung Merapi in Indonesian language , is a conical volcano located on the border between Central Java and Yogyakarta , Indonesia . Mount_Merapi is the most active volcano in Indonesia and Mount_Merapi has erupted regularly since 1548 .

eos Mount_Mitchell_North_Carolina is the highest peak of the Appalachian Mountains and the highest peak in eastern North America , excluding island summits .
eos Mount_Mitchell_North_Carolina was the highest point in any state of the United States until Texas joined the union in 1845 . The nearest higher point on the North American continent is Harney Peak in the Black Hills of South Dakota .
eos The nearest higher point on the North American continent is Harney Peak in the Black Hills of South Dakota . Mount_Mitchell_North_Carolina is protected by Mount Mitchell State Park and surrounded by the Pisgah National Forest .
eos Mount_Mitchell_North_Carolina is located near Burnsville in Yancey County , North Carolina , in the Black Mountain subrange of the Appalachians , and about 32 kilometres ( 20 mi ) northeast of Asheville . Mount_Mitchell_North_Carolina is protected by Mount Mitchell State Park and surrounded by the Pisgah National Forest . eos Mount_Mitchell_North_Carolina is protected by Mount Mitchell State Park and surrounded by the Pisgah National Forest . Mount_Mitchell_North_Carolina was named after Elisha Mitchell , a professor at the University of North Carolina , who determined Mount_Mitchell_North_Carolina height in 1835 and fell to his death at nearby Mitchell Falls in 1857 , having returned to verify his earlier measurements . The ascent of
eos The summit once featured a 40 ft ( 12 m ) stone observation tower , which was torn down in late 2006 and is being replaced by a shorter observation platform . Also at the summit is the tomb of Dr. Mitchell . The weather on
eos The weather on Mount_Mitchell_North_Carolina is very mild in the summer and very harsh in the winter , more like Maine or southeastern Canada than the southeastern US In 1985 , the coldest temperature ever recorded in the state occurred there on january 21 when it fell to -34 ° F ( -37 ° C ) , during a severe cold spell that brought freezing temperatures as far south as Miami .
eos The high elevations also expose plant life to high levels of pollution , including acid precipitation - rain , snow , and fog with very low pH. These acids damage the spruce and fir trees particularly badly , in part by releasing natural metals from the soil like aluminum , and by leaching important minerals . This stress also reduces the trees ' resistance and immunity to insects , especially to non - native introduced pests like the Balsam woolly adelgid ( see aphid ) . While
eos Repairing the damage is a difficult issue , as the pollutants are often carried in from long distances . Sources can be local or hundreds of miles or kilometers away , requiring cooperation from as far away as the Midwest . Still , hundreds of tourists visit

eos Mount_Nebo_Utah is the southernmost and highest mountain in the Wasatch Range of Utah , in the United States . Named after the biblical Mount Nebo overlooking Israel , which is said to be the place of Moses ' death , Mount_Nebo_Utah is the centerpiece of the Mount Nebo Wilderness , inside the Uinta National Forest .
eos Mount_Nebo_Utah is crowned by three peaks , with the northern peak reaching 11,928 ft ( 3,636 m ) . Original surveys placed the southern peak as the highest at 11,877 ft ( 3,620 m ) . Unfortunately , when
eos Original surveys placed the southern peak as the highest at 11,877 ft ( 3,620 m ) . Unfortunately , when Mount_Nebo_Utah was resurveyed in the 1970s and the northern peak was found to be the highest , two substantial trails already led to the south summit . Parts of

eos Mount_Nebo_Utah is a popular , although strenuous , destination for hikers from the nearby town of Nephi , and the city of Salt Lake City . eos Mount_Nyamuragira is an active volcano in the Virunga Mountains of the Democratic Republic of the Congo , situated about 25 km north of Lake Kivu .
eos Mount_Nyamuragira is an active volcano in the Virunga Mountains of the Democratic Republic of the Congo , situated about 25 km north of Lake Kivu . Mount_Nyamuragira has been described as Africa 's most active volcano and Mount_Nyamuragira has erupted over 30 times since 1880 . As well as eruptions from the summit , there have been numerous eruptions from the flanks of
eos Mount_Nyamuragira has been described as Africa 's most active volcano and Mount_Nyamuragira has erupted over 30 times since 1880 . As well as eruptions from the summit , there have been numerous eruptions from the flanks of Mount_Nyamuragira , creating new smaller volcanoes that have lasted only for a short time ( eg Murara from late 1976 to 1977 ) .
eos Mount_Nyamuragira is responsible for a large portion of the sulfur dioxide released into the atmosphere by volcanoes . Extensive lava flows can be seen on satellite photographs going 25 km south - west to Lake Kivu , about 22 km north - west and 35 km north - north - east .

eos Before 1991 , Mount_Pinatubo was inconspicuous and heavily eroded . Mount_Pinatubo was covered in dense forest which supported a population of several thousand indigenous people , the Aeta , who had fled to the mountains from the lowlands when the Spanish conquered the Philippines in 1565 .

eos Mount_Rainier is an active stratovolcano in Pierce County , Washington , located southeast of Seattle , Washington , in the United States .
eos Mount_Rainier is an active stratovolcano in Pierce County , Washington , located southeast of Seattle , Washington , in the United States . Mount_Rainier is the highest peak in the Cascade Range and Cascade Volcanic Arc at 14,411 feet ( 4,392 m ) .
eos Mount_Rainier is the highest peak in the Cascade Range and Cascade Volcanic Arc at 14,411 feet ( 4,392 m ) . Mount_Rainier and the surrounding area are protected within Mount Rainier National Park . With 26 major glaciers ,
eos With 26 major glaciers , Mount_Rainier is the most heavily glaciated peak in the lower 48 states with 35 square miles ( 91 km ) of permanent snowfields and glaciers . The summit is topped by two volcanic craters , each over 1,000 feet ( 300 m ) in diameter with the larger east crater overlapping the west crater . Geothermal heat from
eos Geothermal heat from Mount_Rainier keeps areas of both crater rims free of snow and ice , and has formed an extensive network of glacier caves within the ice - filled craters . A small crater lake , the highest in North America , occupies the lowest portion of the west crater below more than 160 feet ( 50 m ) of ice and is accessible only via the caves .

eos Mount_Robson ( or Robson Peak ) is the highest point in the Canadian Rockies .
eos Mount_Robson ( or Robson Peak ) is the highest point in the Canadian Rockies . Mount_Robson is located entirely within Mount Robson Provincial Park of British Columbia , and Mount_Robson is part of the Rainbow Range .
eos Mount_Robson is commonly thought to be the highest point in BC , but that distinction is held by Mount Fairweather at 4663 m . The highest mountain in Canada is Mount Logan at 5959 m.
eos The highest mountain in Canada is Mount Logan at 5959 m. Mount_Robson was named in 1915 by Colin Robertson , an employee of the Hudson 's Bay Company . The Texqakallt , a Secwepemc people and the earliest inhabitants of the area , call
eos The Texqakallt , a Secwepemc people and the earliest inhabitants of the area , call Mount_Robson Yuh - hai - has - kun or The Mountain of the Spiral Road . Other unofficial names include Cloud Cap Mountain and Snow Cap Mountain .
eos Other unofficial names include Cloud Cap Mountain and Snow Cap Mountain . Mount_Robson boasts great vertical relief over the local terrain . From Berg Lake
eos Mount_Robson boasts great vertical relief over the local terrain . From Berg Lake Mount_Robson rises almost 8,000 feet to the summit . The north face of
eos From Berg Lake Mount_Robson rises almost 8,000 feet to the summit . The north face of Mount_Robson is heavily glaciated and 800 metres ( 2600 ft ) of ice plunge down from the top to the shores of Berg Lake . The south side of

eos Mount_Rogers is the highest point in the state of Virginia , USA , with a summit elevation of 5,729 feet ( 1,746 metres ) above mean sea level .
eos The Mount Rogers area contains a unique record of the geohistory of Virginia . There is evidence from the rocks that volcanoes were part of the landscape , but not for about 200 million years . Roughly 750 million years ago , rift - related ( divergent ) volcanoes erupted along the axis of what later became the Appalachians , and one remnant of that volcanic zone , with its volcanic rocks , still can be seen at
eos There is evidence from the rocks that volcanoes were part of the landscape , but not for about 200 million years . Roughly 750 million years ago , rift - related ( divergent ) volcanoes erupted along the axis of what later became the Appalachians , and one remnant of that volcanic zone , with its volcanic rocks , still can be seen at Mount_Rogers . Massive rhyolite lava flows erupted at
eos Roughly 750 million years ago , rift - related ( divergent ) volcanoes erupted along the axis of what later became the Appalachians , and one remnant of that volcanic zone , with its volcanic rocks , still can be seen at Mount_Rogers . Massive rhyolite lava flows erupted at Mount_Rogers during the Precambrian rifting event .

eos The North Island 's major skifields and only glaciers are on Mount_Ruapehu slopes . Mount_Ruapehu is one of the world 's most active volcanoes and the largest active volcano in New Zealand .

eos Mount_Shasta , a 14,179-foot ( 4,322 m ) stratovolcano , is the second - highest peak in the Cascade Range and the fifth highest peak in California .

eos Mount_Shasta , a 14,179-foot ( 4,322 m ) stratovolcano , is the second - highest peak in the Cascade Range and the fifth highest peak in California . Mount_Shasta is a member in the Cascade Volcanic Arc and Mount_Shasta is located in Siskiyou County , and Mount_Shasta has an estimated volume of 108 cubic miles ( 450 km ³ ) , making Mount_Shasta the most voluminous stratovolcano of the Cascades . Physically unconnected to any nearby mountain , and rising abruptly from miles of level ground which encircle
eos Mount_Shasta , a 14,179-foot ( 4,322 m ) stratovolcano , is the second - highest peak in the Cascade Range and the fifth highest peak in California . Mount_Shasta is a member in the Cascade Volcanic Arc and Mount_Shasta is located in Siskiyou County , and Mount_Shasta has an estimated volume of 108 cubic miles ( 450 km ³ ) , making Mount_Shasta the most voluminous stratovolcano of the Cascades . Physically unconnected to any nearby mountain , and rising abruptly from miles of level ground which encircle Mount_Shasta ,
eos Mount_Shasta is a member in the Cascade Volcanic Arc and Mount_Shasta is located in Siskiyou County , and Mount_Shasta has an estimated volume of 108 cubic miles ( 450 km ³ ) , making Mount_Shasta the most voluminous stratovolcano of the Cascades . Physically unconnected to any nearby mountain , and rising abruptly from miles of level ground which encircle Mount_Shasta , Mount_Shasta stands some 10,000 feet ( 3,000 m ) above the surrounding area .

eos Mount_Si ( pronounced sigh ) is a small mountain in the US state of Washington . Although just 4,167 ft high ,
eos Mount_Si ( pronounced sigh ) is a small mountain in the US state of Washington . Although just 4,167 ft high , Mount_Si lies on the western margin of the Cascade Range just above the coastal plains around Puget Sound , and Mount_Si towers over the nearby town of North Bend .
eos Mount_Si was named after local homesteader Josiah ` ` Uncle Si '' Merritt .
eos ` ` Uncle Si '' Merritt . Mount_Si was made famous in the show Twin Peaks , which was filmed in North Bend . Only about a 45-minute drive from Seattle ,
eos Only about a 45-minute drive from Seattle , Mount_Si is a favorite outdoor destination for Puget Sound locals . On most summer days one can count numerous hikers on the trail to the summit .

eos Mount_Sidley is marked by a spectacular caldera on the southern side and Mount_Sidley stands NE of Mount Waesche in the southern part of the range . eos Mount_Siple is a dormant shield volcano , rising to 3,110 metres ( 10,203 ft ) and dominating the northwest part of Siple Island , which is separated from the Bakutis Coast , Marie Byrd Land , by the Getz Ice Shelf .
eos Mount_Siple is a dormant shield volcano , rising to 3,110 metres ( 10,203 ft ) and dominating the northwest part of Siple Island , which is separated from the Bakutis Coast , Marie Byrd Land , by the Getz Ice Shelf . Mount_Siple youthful appearance strongly suggests that
eos Mount_Siple is a dormant shield volcano , rising to 3,110 metres ( 10,203 ft ) and dominating the northwest part of Siple Island , which is separated from the Bakutis Coast , Marie Byrd Land , by the Getz Ice Shelf . Mount_Siple youthful appearance strongly suggests that Mount_Siple last erupted sometime during the Holocene .
eos Mount_Siple youthful appearance strongly suggests that Mount_Siple last erupted sometime during the Holocene . Mount_Siple is capped by a 4 x 5 km ( 2.5 x 3 mi ) summit caldera , and tuff cones lie on the lower flanks .
eos Mount_Siple is capped by a 4 x 5 km ( 2.5 x 3 mi ) summit caldera , and tuff cones lie on the lower flanks . Mount_Siple massive volume of 1,800 cubic kilometres ( 430 cu mi ) is comparable to that of Mount Erebus .
eos Mount_Siple massive volume of 1,800 cubic kilometres ( 430 cu mi ) is comparable to that of Mount Erebus . Mount_Siple is named after Paul Allen Siple ( 1908 - 68 ) , American Antarctic explorer and geographer who took part in six Antarctic expeditions , including the two Byrd expeditions of 1928 - 30 and 1933 - 35 ( Siple Coast , Siple Island ) . He was in command of the West Base of the US Antarctic Service ( USAS ) , 1939 - 41 , and was navigator on all major exploratory flights from the base , including the flight on which
eos He was in command of the West Base of the US Antarctic Service ( USAS ) , 1939 - 41 , and was navigator on all major exploratory flights from the base , including the flight on which Mount_Siple was discovered . He served as US Army Senior Representative on Operation Highjump , 1946 - 47 ; as Director of Scientific Projects in the planning stages for the US - IGY ; and as the inaugural scientific leader at the US Amundsen - Scott South Pole Station 1956 - 57 . eos Mount_Tambora ( or Tomboro ) is an active stratovolcano on Sumbawa island , Indonesia . Sumbawa is flanked both to the north and south by oceanic crust , and Mount_Tambora was formed by the active subduction zones beneath it . This raised Mount_Tambora as high as 4,300 m ( 14,000 ft ) , making Mount_Tambora one of the tallest peaks in the Indonesian archipelago , and drained off a large magma chamber inside
eos This raised Mount_Tambora as high as 4,300 m ( 14,000 ft ) , making Mount_Tambora one of the tallest peaks in the Indonesian archipelago , and drained off a large magma chamber inside Mount_Tambora . eos Mount_Tapuaenuku , formerly Mount Tapuaenuku , is the highest peak in the northeast of New Zealand 's South Island . The name translates from Māori as ` ` footprint of the rainbow '' , though Mount_Tapuaenuku is usually regarded as being named after Chief Tapuaenuku . At 2880 metres
eos The name translates from Māori as ` ` footprint of the rainbow '' , though Mount_Tapuaenuku is usually regarded as being named after Chief Tapuaenuku . At 2880 metres Mount_Tapuaenuku is the highest mountain in New Zealand outside the main ranges of the Southern Alps , and over 50 metres taller than the tallest peak in the North Island .
eos At 2880 metres Mount_Tapuaenuku is the highest mountain in New Zealand outside the main ranges of the Southern Alps , and over 50 metres taller than the tallest peak in the North Island . Mount_Tapuaenuku dominates the Inland Kaikoura Range , rising high above the valleys of the Clarence and Awatere Rivers .
eos Mount_Tapuaenuku dominates the Inland Kaikoura Range , rising high above the valleys of the Clarence and Awatere Rivers . Mount_Tapuaenuku can be seen from as far away as Cape Terawhiti on the southeastern tip of the North Island , nearly 120 kilometres away , and Mount_Tapuaenuku is a prominent point on the horizon for travellers on the interisland ferries that ply Cook Strait . The first European to sight Mount_Tapuaenuku was James Cook , who called Mount_Tapuaenuku Mount Odin , but later nicknamed Mount_Tapuaenuku ` ` The Watcher '' since his ship seemed to be visible from

eos Mount_Terror_Antarctica was named in 1841 by Sir James Clark Ross for his second ship , the HMS Terror . The rocks at the summit have not been studied , but lower areas have been studied and rocks from those areas range from 0.82 to 1.75 million years old .

eos The first ascent of Mount_Terror_Antarctica was made by a New Zealand party in 1959 . eos Mount_Veniaminof is an active stratovolcano located on the Alaska Peninsula . The Alaska Volcano Observatory currently rates Mount_Veniaminof as Aviation Color Code Green and Volcano Alert Level Normal .

eos The Steamboat Ski Resort operates on 2,939 acres of Mount_Werner . It is serviced by the Silver Bullet Gondola lift and several chairlifts .

eos Mulanje_Massif , also known as Mount Mulanje , is a large monadnock in southern Malawi near the city of Blantyre , rising sharply from the surrounding plains of Chiradzulu , and the tea - growing Mulanje district .
eos Mulanje_Massif , also known as Mount Mulanje , is a large monadnock in southern Malawi near the city of Blantyre , rising sharply from the surrounding plains of Chiradzulu , and the tea - growing Mulanje district . eos Mulanje_Massif has a maximum elevation of 3,002 m at Mulanje_Massif highest point , Sapitwa Peak . Much of Mulanje_Massif consists of rolling grassland at elevations of 1800 - 2200 m , intersected by deep forested ravines .
eos Much of Mulanje_Massif consists of rolling grassland at elevations of 1800 - 2200 m , intersected by deep forested ravines . Mulanje_Massif has many individual peaks reaching heights of over 2500 m , including Chambe Peak , the West Face of which is the longest rock climb in Africa .
eos Mulanje_Massif has many individual peaks reaching heights of over 2500 m , including Chambe Peak , the West Face of which is the longest rock climb in Africa . eos The first European to report seeing Mulanje_Massif was David Livingstone in 1859 , but archeological investigation reveals evidence of human visits to Mulanje_Massif from the Stone Age onwards . The elevation of Mulanje_Massif is high enough for Mulanje_Massif disturb upper level air flow and induce rain clouds to form around Mulanje_Massif , making Mulanje_Massif an important source of rain water at the head of almost every river that runs through this part of Malawi . The forested slopes of
eos The forested slopes of Mulanje_Massif support a sizable timber industry . At one time there was a cableway to transport timber from the edge of the plateau down to the Likhubula Forestry Station , but it fell into disrepair , and currently planks are carried down manually .

The land around the park is threatened by growing population , land use patterns such as forest clearing for farming and firewood , and invasive species such as Mexican Pine and Himalayan Raspberry .

eos Mulhacin is part of the Sierra Nevada range in the Cordillera Penibética . Mulhacin is named after Muley Abul Hassan , the penultimate Muslim King of Granada in the 15th century , who according to legend was buried on the summit of Mulhacin . While not of exceptional height by European standards ,
eos Mulhacin is named after Muley Abul Hassan , the penultimate Muslim King of Granada in the 15th century , who according to legend was buried on the summit of Mulhacin . While not of exceptional height by European standards , Mulhacin is the highest peak in Europe outside the Caucasus Mountains and the Alps .
eos While not of exceptional height by European standards , Mulhacin is the highest peak in Europe outside the Caucasus Mountains and the Alps . Mulhacin is also the third most topographically prominent peak in Western Europe , after Mont Blanc and Mount Etna , and Mulhacin is ranked 64th in the world by prominence .
eos Mulhacin is also the third most topographically prominent peak in Western Europe , after Mont Blanc and Mount Etna , and Mulhacin is ranked 64th in the world by prominence . Mulhacin is not exceptionally dramatic in terms of steepness or local relief . The south flank of
eos The south flank of Mulhacin is gentle , and presents no technical challenge , as is the case for the long west ridge . The shorter , somewhat steeper north east ridge is slightly more technical . The north face of
eos The shorter , somewhat steeper north east ridge is slightly more technical . The north face of Mulhacin , however , is much steeper , and offers several routes involving moderately steep climbing on snow and ice ( up to French grade AD ) in the winter .
eos The north face of Mulhacin , however , is much steeper , and offers several routes involving moderately steep climbing on snow and ice ( up to French grade AD ) in the winter . Mulhacin can be climbed in a single day from the villages of either Capileira or Trevelez , but it is more common to spend a night at the mountain refuge at Poqueira , or in the bare shelter at Caldera to the west . Those making the ascent from Trevelez can also bivouac at the tarns to the northeast of

eos Muztagh_Tower ( also : Mustagh Tower ; Muztagh : ice tower ) , is a mountain of the Karakoram range in the Himalaya in Northern Areas of Pakistan .
eos Muztagh : ice tower ) , is a mountain of the Karakoram range in the Himalaya in Northern Areas of Pakistan . Muztagh_Tower is often said to be one of the most difficult mountains in the world to climb .
eos Muztagh_Tower is often said to be one of the most difficult mountains in the world to climb . Muztagh_Tower stands 7,273 metres high between the basins of the Baltoro and Sarpo Laggo glaciers , and Muztagh_Tower also possesses a second summit , on the northeast ridge , that is 7,180 m high . Long considered unclimbable ,
eos Muztagh_Tower stands 7,273 metres high between the basins of the Baltoro and Sarpo Laggo glaciers , and Muztagh_Tower also possesses a second summit , on the northeast ridge , that is 7,180 m high . Long considered unclimbable , Muztagh_Tower was first summited in 1956 by a British expedition , consisting of John Hartog , Joe Brown , Tom Patey and Ian McNaught Davis , that came from the west side . eos Nadelhorn ( 4,327 m ) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps in Switzerland .
eos Nadelhorn ( 4,327 m ) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps in Switzerland . Nadelhorn is the highest point on the Nadelgrat , a high - level ridge running roughly north - south above the resort of Saas - Fee to the east , and the Mattertal to the west .
eos Nadelhorn is the highest point on the Nadelgrat , a high - level ridge running roughly north - south above the resort of Saas - Fee to the east , and the Mattertal to the west . Nadelhorn three ridges join to form a sharp - pointed summit , which looks like a needle ( German : Nadel ) when seen from the north .

eos Nevado_Sajama is an extinct stratovolcano and the highest peak in Bolivia . Nevado_Sajama is located in Sajama National Park in the southwest area of the country some 16 - 24 km ( 10 - 15 mi ) from the border with Chile .
eos Nevado_Sajama is located in Sajama National Park in the southwest area of the country some 16 - 24 km ( 10 - 15 mi ) from the border with Chile . eos Nevado_de_Toluca is a large stratovolcano in central Mexico , located about 80 km west of Mexico City near the city of Toluca .
eos Nevado_de_Toluca is a large stratovolcano in central Mexico , located about 80 km west of Mexico City near the city of Toluca . Nevado_de_Toluca is generally cited as the fourth highest of Mexico 's peaks , after Pico de Orizaba , Popocatépetl , and Iztaccíhuatl , although by some measurements , Sierra Negra is slightly higher .
eos Nevado_de_Toluca is generally cited as the fourth highest of Mexico 's peaks , after Pico de Orizaba , Popocatépetl , and Iztaccíhuatl , although by some measurements , Sierra Negra is slightly higher . Nevado_de_Toluca is often called by the Nahuatl name Xinantécatl , ` ` Senor Desnudo '' in spanish , which is usually translated as ` ` The Naked Man '' although other etymologies have been suggested such as ` ` Lord of the Cornstalks '' ( chinām ( itl ) ` cornstalks ' + tēcatl ` lord of ' ) .
eos The highest summit , Pico del Fraile ( Friar 's Peak ) , is on the south side of the crater and the second highest , Pico de la Aguila ( Eagle 's Peak ) , is on the north . There are two crater lakes on the floor of the basin at about 4200 m , the larger Laguna del Sol ( Sun Lake ) and the smaller , but deeper , Laguna de la Luna ( Moon Lake ) . A road runs into the caldera to the lakes , making
eos There are two crater lakes on the floor of the basin at about 4200 m , the larger Laguna del Sol ( Sun Lake ) and the smaller , but deeper , Laguna de la Luna ( Moon Lake ) . eos The long east - west trending main ridge of Nuptse is crowned by seven peaks : The main peak , Nuptse I , was first climbed on May 16 , 1961 by Dennis Davis and Sherpa Tashi , members of a British expedition . eos Paricutin ( or Volcán de Parícutin , commonly also accented Paricutín or spelled unaccented as Paricutin ) is a volcano in the Mexican state of Michoacán , close to a lava - covered village of the same name . Paricutin appears on many versions of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World .

eos One of the most dramatic eruptive events in Parinacota_Volcano past was 8000 years ago , when a major collapse of the edifice produced 6 km ³ debris avalanche . That avalanche blocked drainage patterns in some of the local area , creating Chungará Lake .

eos Pico_Bolivar is the highest mountain in Venezuela , at 4,981 meters . Located in Mérida State , Pico_Bolivar top is permanently covered with Névé snow and three small glaciers .
eos Located in Mérida State , Pico_Bolivar top is permanently covered with Névé snow and three small glaciers . Pico_Bolivar can be reached by means of the Mérida Cable Car , the highest cable car in the world , which departs from the homonymous city .
eos Pico_Bolivar can be reached by means of the Mérida Cable Car , the highest cable car in the world , which departs from the homonymous city . Pico_Bolivar is named after the Venezuelan independence hero Simon Bolívar .
eos Pico_Bolivar is located on the mountain previously called La Columna , next to El León ( 4,743 m ) and El Toro ( 4,695 m ) . The new name was suggested by Miguel Febres Cordero in 1925 .

eos As determined by a border survey expedition in 1962 , Pico_da_Neblina summit lies barely within Brazilian territory , being a mere 687 metres ( 2,254 feet ) from the Venezuelan border at Pico 31 de Março . The latter is only 21 metres lower , Brazil 's second highest mountain and the highest mountain in Venezuela outside of the Andes .

eos Furthermore , Pico_da_Neblina is not table - shaped , but a rather sharp peak . The word neblina means ` ` fog '' in both Portuguese and Spanish ; so , Pico_da_Neblina name ( meaning ` ` Peak of the Mists '' ) reflects the fact that Pico_da_Neblina is shrouded in dense clouds most of the time .
eos The word neblina means ` ` fog '' in both Portuguese and Spanish ; so , Pico_da_Neblina name ( meaning ` ` Peak of the Mists '' ) reflects the fact that Pico_da_Neblina is shrouded in dense clouds most of the time . eos Pico_de_Orizaba , or Citlaltépetl ( from Nahuatl citlal ( in ) = star , and tepētl = mountain ) , is the highest mountain in Mexico and the third highest in North America .
eos Pico_de_Orizaba , or Citlaltépetl ( from Nahuatl citlal ( in ) = star , and tepētl = mountain ) , is the highest mountain in Mexico and the third highest in North America . Pico_de_Orizaba rises 5,636 meters ( 18,490 feet ) above sea level in the eastern end of the Eje Volcánico Transversal mountain range , on the border between the states of Veracruz and Puebla .

eos Pidurutalagala ( , literally ` ` straw plateau rock '' , also known as Mount Pedro ) is a mountain in the central hill - country of Sri Lanka , close to the city of Nuwara Eliya . At a height of 2.534 metres ( 8,281 feet ) , Pidurutalagala is the highest mountain in Sri Lanka .

eos Pikes_Peak ( originally Pike 's Peak , see below ) is a mountain in the Front Range of the Rocky Mountains , west of Colorado Springs , Colorado , in El Paso County .
eos Pikes_Peak ( originally Pike 's Peak , see below ) is a mountain in the Front Range of the Rocky Mountains , west of Colorado Springs , Colorado , in El Paso County . Pikes_Peak is named for Zebulon Pike , an explorer who led an expedition to the southern Colorado area in 1806 . At 14115 ft ,

eos Pilatus_mountain is a mountain near Lucerne , Switzerland . Jurisdiction over
eos Pilatus_mountain is a mountain near Lucerne , Switzerland . Jurisdiction over Pilatus_mountain is divided between the cantons of Obwalden , Nidwalden , and Lucerne .
eos Pilatus_mountain is in Obwalden right on the border with Nidwalden . The top can be reached with the Pilatus Railway , the world 's steepest cogwheel railway from Alpnachstad , operating from May to november ( depending on snow conditions ) , and the whole year with the aerial panorama gondolas and aerial cableways from Kriens .
eos Pilatus_mountain has the longest summer toboggan track in Switzerland ( 0.88 miles or 1.350 km ) and the biggest suspension rope park in Central Switzerland . During the summer , the ` ` Golden Round Trip '' - a popular route for tourists - involves taking a boat from Lucerne across Lake Lucerne to Alpnachstad , going up on the cogwheel railway , coming down on the aerial cableways and panorama gondolas , and taking a bus back to Lucerne .
eos During the summer , the ` ` Golden Round Trip '' - a popular route for tourists - involves taking a boat from Lucerne across Lake Lucerne to Alpnachstad , going up on the cogwheel railway , coming down on the aerial cableways and panorama gondolas , and taking a bus back to Lucerne . Pilatus_mountain was named after a local legend which alleges that Pontius Pilate was buried there . Numbered amongst those who have reached

eos Pilot_Mountain_Alberta is a mountain in the Bow River valley of Banff National Park in Alberta , Canada . Pilot_Mountain_Alberta is located southeast of Redearth Creek and directly west of the Trans - Canada Highway . eos Pilot_Mountain_Alberta is located southeast of Redearth Creek and directly west of the Trans - Canada Highway . eos Piton_des_Neiges ( Snow Peak ) is a massive 3,069 m ( 10,069 ft ) shield volcano on Réunion , one of the volcanic islands in the Mascarene Archipelago in the southwestern Indian Ocean .
eos Piton_des_Neiges ( Snow Peak ) is a massive 3,069 m ( 10,069 ft ) shield volcano on Réunion , one of the volcanic islands in the Mascarene Archipelago in the southwestern Indian Ocean . Piton_des_Neiges was formed by the Réunion hotspot and Piton_des_Neiges emerged from the sea about two million years ago . Now deeply eroded ,
eos Piton_des_Neiges was formed by the Réunion hotspot and Piton_des_Neiges emerged from the sea about two million years ago . Now deeply eroded , Piton_des_Neiges has been inactive for 20,000 years and Piton_des_Neiges is surrounded by three massive crater valleys , the Cirques .
eos Piton_des_Neiges forms the northwestern two thirds of Réunion , with the very active Piton de la Fournaise comprising the rest . The volcanic island is considered to be about three million years old ( Pliocene ) ; the other two islands in the archipelago , Mauritius and Rodrigues , are 7.8 million ( Miocene ) and 1 1/2 million ( Pleistocene ) years old , respectively . The island possesses a high endemism of flowering plants ( about 225 ) ; this has justified the creation of a biological reserve on the lower slopes of

eos Piz_Badile ( 3,308 m ) is a mountain in the Bregaglia range in Switzerland and Italy , the border between the two countries running along the summit ridge .
eos Piz_Badile ( 3,308 m ) is a mountain in the Bregaglia range in Switzerland and Italy , the border between the two countries running along the summit ridge . Piz_Badile north - east face is considered one of the six great north faces of the Alps . The first ascent of
eos Piz_Badile north - east face is considered one of the six great north faces of the Alps . The first ascent of Piz_Badile was by W A. B Coolidge with guides F and H Dévouassoud on 27 july 1867 by the south ridge .
eos Piz_Badile had first come to the notice of British alpinists from D W. Freshfield 's writings of the 1860s . He gave the name ` the Grey Twins ' to Piz Badile and Piz Cengalo , and made the first ascent of Piz Cengalo in 1866 . The two classic routes on
eos The two classic routes on Piz_Badile are the north ridge and the Cassin Route on the north - east face . The north ridge - the Badilekante - was first prospected solo by the Swiss guide Christian Klucker in 1892 ( Klucker later made the first ascent of

eos Piz_Buin forms the border between Graubünden and Vorarlberg . Piz_Buin is the highest mountain peak in Vorarlberg .
eos Piz_Buin original name in the Romansh language of the Swiss canton Graubünden is Piz Buin Grand . A very similar summit nearby is called Piz Buin Pitschen ; it has the same shape but is slightly lower ( 3,255 m or 10,680 ft ) .

eos Piz_Morteratsch ( 3,751 m ) is a mountain in the Bernina Range in Switzerland .
eos Piz_Morteratsch is bordered on the east by the Morteratsch Glacier and on the south - west by the Tschierva Glacier . One of the easiest mountains in the range to climb , the normal route follows that taken by the first ascentionists C Brügger and P Gensler with guides Karl Emmermann and Angelo Klaingutti on 11 september 1858 . eos Piz_Palu ( 3,901 m ) is a mountain in the Bernina Range in Switzerland and Italy . There are three summits on Piz_Palu main ridge , which runs from east to west . The name Palü derives from the Latin palus , meaning a swamp , and Piz_Palu is probably named after the Alpe Palü , a high alpine pasture some 4 km to
eos There are three summits on Piz_Palu main ridge , which runs from east to west . The name Palü derives from the Latin palus , meaning a swamp , and Piz_Palu is probably named after the Alpe Palü , a high alpine pasture some 4 km to Piz_Palu east . It is uncertain when
eos The name Palü derives from the Latin palus , meaning a swamp , and Piz_Palu is probably named after the Alpe Palü , a high alpine pasture some 4 km to Piz_Palu east . It is uncertain when Piz_Palu was first climbed , but the first ascent of the central and highest peak was probably by K E. Digby with guide Peter Jenny and a porter in 1866 .
eos The east peak ( 3,882 m ) was climbed by Oswald Heer , and P and M Flury , with guides Johann Madutz and Gian marchet Colani ( the ` King of the Bernina ' ) on 12 august 1835 . All three peaks were first traversed by Wachler , Wallner , George , Hans Gross and Christian Gross on 22 july 1868 .

eos The first ascent of Piz_Scerscen was by Paul Güssfeldt , Hans Grass and Caspar Capat on 13 september 1877 via the north - west spur , descending the same way . This is the well - known Eisnase route , involving a 100-metre ice pitch of between 60 - 70 ° , although its precise length and steepness are debated . eos Pollux_mountain ( 4,092 m ) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps on the border between Valais , Switzerland and the Aosta Valley in Italy .
eos Pollux_mountain ( 4,092 m ) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps on the border between Valais , Switzerland and the Aosta Valley in Italy . Pollux_mountain is the lower of a pair of twin peaks ( the other being Castor ) named after the Gemini twins of Roman mythology .
eos Pollux_mountain is the lower of a pair of twin peaks ( the other being Castor ) named after the Gemini twins of Roman mythology . Pollux_mountain is separated from Castor by a pass at 3,845 m ( 12,615 ft ) , named the Passo di Verra in Italian and the Zwillingsjoch in German .
eos The first ascent was by Jules Jacot from Geneva with guides Josef - Marie Perren and Peter Taugwalder ( father ) on august 1 ( the Swiss national day ) 1864 . Their route was via the Schwartztor , a pass first crossed by John Ball and Gabriel Zumtaugwald in 1845 . eos Their route was via the Schwartztor , a pass first crossed by John Ball and Gabriel Zumtaugwald in 1845 . eos Popocatipetl ( commonly referred to as El Popo or Don Goyo ) ( "" IPA : popokaˈtepetɬ "" ) is an active volcano and the second highest peak in Mexico after the Pico de Orizaba ( 5,636 m ) .
eos ( "" IPA : popokaˈtepetɬ "" ) is an active volcano and the second highest peak in Mexico after the Pico de Orizaba ( 5,636 m ) . Popocatipetl comes from the Nahuatl words popōca ` it smokes ' and tepētl ` mountain ' , thus Smoking Mountain .
eos Popocatipetl comes from the Nahuatl words popōca ` it smokes ' and tepētl ` mountain ' , thus Smoking Mountain . Popocatipetl is linked to the Iztaccíhuatl volcano to the north by the high saddle known as the Paso de Cortés , and Popocatipetl lies in the eastern half of the Trans - Mexican volcanic belt .
eos Popocatipetl is linked to the Iztaccíhuatl volcano to the north by the high saddle known as the Paso de Cortés , and Popocatipetl lies in the eastern half of the Trans - Mexican volcanic belt . Popocatipetl is one of the most active volcanoes in Mexico , having had more than 20 major eruptions since the arrival of the Spanish in 1519 .
eos Popocatipetl is currently active . A major eruption occurred in 1947 to begin this cycle of activity . Then , on december 21 , 1994
eos The activity prompted the evacuation of nearby towns and scientists to begin monitoring for an eruption . In december 2000 , tens of thousands of people were evacuated by the government based on the warnings of scientists .
eos The activity prompted the evacuation of nearby towns and scientists to begin monitoring for an eruption . In december 2000 , tens of thousands of people were evacuated by the government based on the warnings of scientists . Popocatipetl then made
eos In december 2000 , tens of thousands of people were evacuated by the government based on the warnings of scientists . Popocatipetl then made Popocatipetl largest display in thousands of years .
eos In december 2000 , tens of thousands of people were evacuated by the government based on the warnings of scientists . Popocatipetl then made Popocatipetl largest display in thousands of years . Popocatipetl is only 70 km to the southeast of Mexico City , from where
eos Popocatipetl then made Popocatipetl largest display in thousands of years . Popocatipetl is only 70 km to the southeast of Mexico City , from where Popocatipetl can be seen regularly , depending on atmospheric conditions . The residents of Puebla , a mere 40 km east of
eos Popocatipetl then made Popocatipetl largest display in thousands of years . Popocatipetl is only 70 km to the southeast of Mexico City , from where Popocatipetl can be seen regularly , depending on atmospheric conditions . eos Popocatipetl is only 70 km to the southeast of Mexico City , from where Popocatipetl can be seen regularly , depending on atmospheric conditions . The residents of Puebla , a mere 40 km east of Popocatipetl , enjoy the views of Popocatipetl almost all year long .

eos Pumari_Chhish was first attempted by an Austrian group in 1974 , who failed to climb or bypass the Yazghil Glacier on the north side of Pumari_Chhish . In 1979 , a Japanese group from the Hokkaido Alpine Association succeeded in climbing Pumari_Chhish via a long route starting from the Khunyang Glacier , well to the west of Pumari_Chhish . They first had to cross a significant col to access the upper Yazghil Glacier ; they then ascended the north ridge of

eos Pumori ( or Pumo Ri ) is a mountain in the Himalaya on the Nepal - Tibet border .
eos Pumori ( or Pumo Ri ) is a mountain in the Himalaya on the Nepal - Tibet border . Pumori lies just eight kilometres west of Mount Everest .

eos Pumori , which means ` ` Ummarried Daughter '' in the Sherpa dialect , was named by George Mallory . Climbers sometimes refer to Pumori as ` ` Everest 's Daughter '' .
eos Climbers sometimes refer to Pumori as ` ` Everest 's Daughter '' . Pumori is a popular climbing peak and the easiest route is graded class 3 , although with avalanche danger .

eos Puncak_Jaya ( pronounced "" ˈpʊntʃak ˈdʒaja "" ) , sometimes called Mount Carstensz or the Carstensz Pyramid , is the highest mountain on the island of New Guinea , on the Australia - New Guinea continent and in Oceania .
eos Puncak_Jaya ( pronounced "" ˈpʊntʃak ˈdʒaja "" ) , sometimes called Mount Carstensz or the Carstensz Pyramid , is the highest mountain on the island of New Guinea , on the Australia - New Guinea continent and in Oceania . Puncak_Jaya is the highest point between the Himalayas and the Andes and the highest island peak in the world .

eos Rendezvous_Mountain is a large mountain massif located in the southern Teton Range . The west and northern flanks of Rendezvous_Mountain are in Grand Teton National Park , Wyoming , while much of the remainder of Rendezvous_Mountain is in Bridger - Teton National Forest .
eos Rendezvous_Mountain extends for a distance of 5 miles ( 8 km ) between Granite Canyon to the north and Phillips Canyon to the south . eos Sahand ( Persian : سهند ) is a massive , heavily eroded stratovolcano in northwestern Iran . At 3707 m , Sahand is the highest mountain in the Iranian province of East Azarbaijan .

San_Jacinto_Peak is also frequently named Mount San Jacinto . The steep escarpment of
eos The steep escarpment of San_Jacinto_Peak north face , above Snow Creek , climbs over 10,000 feet ( 3 km ) in 7 miles ( 11.3 km ) . This is one of the largest gains in elevation over such a small horizontal distance in the contiguous United States .
eos Perkins named Jean Peak for his sweetheart and future bride , Jean Waters of Plumas County , whom he married in 1903 . He named Marion Mountain after Marion Kelly , his girlfriend , a teacher for the Indian Bureau at the Morongo Valley Reservation . eos Santa_Fe_Baldy is a prominent summit in the Sangre de Cristo Mountains of New Mexico , United States , located 15 mi ( 24 km ) northeast of Santa Fe . There are no higher mountains in New Mexico south of Santa_Fe_Baldy . eos Santa_Fe_Baldy is a prominent summit in the Sangre de Cristo Mountains of New Mexico , United States , located 15 mi ( 24 km ) northeast of Santa Fe . There are no higher mountains in New Mexico south of Santa_Fe_Baldy . Santa_Fe_Baldy is prominent as seen from Los Alamos and communities along the Rio Grande in northern New Mexico , but Santa_Fe_Baldy is relatively inconspicuous from Santa Fe , as Santa_Fe_Baldy north - south trending main ridge line is seen nearly end - on , disguising the size of
eos There are no higher mountains in New Mexico south of Santa_Fe_Baldy . Santa_Fe_Baldy is prominent as seen from Los Alamos and communities along the Rio Grande in northern New Mexico , but Santa_Fe_Baldy is relatively inconspicuous from Santa Fe , as Santa_Fe_Baldy north - south trending main ridge line is seen nearly end - on , disguising the size of Santa_Fe_Baldy . Tree line in the Sangre de Cristos is unusually high ( exceeding 12,000 ft/3 , 660 m in places ) and only the top 600 - 800 ft ( 180 - 240 m ) of
eos Santa_Fe_Baldy is prominent as seen from Los Alamos and communities along the Rio Grande in northern New Mexico , but Santa_Fe_Baldy is relatively inconspicuous from Santa Fe , as Santa_Fe_Baldy north - south trending main ridge line is seen nearly end - on , disguising the size of Santa_Fe_Baldy . Tree line in the Sangre de Cristos is unusually high ( exceeding 12,000 ft/3 , 660 m in places ) and only the top 600 - 800 ft ( 180 - 240 m ) of Santa_Fe_Baldy is perpetually free of trees , but several severe forest fires have created bare spots extending to lower elevations . An extensive region of aspen trees on
eos Tree line in the Sangre de Cristos is unusually high ( exceeding 12,000 ft/3 , 660 m in places ) and only the top 600 - 800 ft ( 180 - 240 m ) of Santa_Fe_Baldy is perpetually free of trees , but several severe forest fires have created bare spots extending to lower elevations . An extensive region of aspen trees on Santa_Fe_Baldy flanks produces spectacular orange - yellow coloration during the fall that is the subject of many photographic studies .
eos Santa_Fe_Baldy lies in the Pecos Wilderness , part of the Santa Fe National Forest , on the water divide between the Rio Grande and the Pecos River . The western slopes are drained by the Rio Capulin and the Rio Nambe , both flowing to the Rio Grande . The eastern side of
eos The western slopes are drained by the Rio Capulin and the Rio Nambe , both flowing to the Rio Grande . The eastern side of Santa_Fe_Baldy consists of two small cirques , one containing Lake Katherine , one of the highest lakes in New Mexico , at elevation 11,742 ft ( 3,579 m ) .
eos The eastern side of Santa_Fe_Baldy consists of two small cirques , one containing Lake Katherine , one of the highest lakes in New Mexico , at elevation 11,742 ft ( 3,579 m ) . Santa_Fe_Baldy is accessed by Trail 251 , the Skyline Trail , which climbs to a saddle about 1,000 ft ( 300 m ) below the summit ; the remaining distance is covered by a steep unofficial trail along the ridgeline . Under good conditions the summit is a simple ` ` walk - up '' climb , but the Sangre de Cristos are unusually prone to lightning , and during the summer months , the wise hiker is off
eos Santa_Fe_Baldy is accessed by Trail 251 , the Skyline Trail , which climbs to a saddle about 1,000 ft ( 300 m ) below the summit ; the remaining distance is covered by a steep unofficial trail along the ridgeline . Under good conditions the summit is a simple ` ` walk - up '' climb , but the Sangre de Cristos are unusually prone to lightning , and during the summer months , the wise hiker is off Santa_Fe_Baldy and other high summits in the range by noon , to avoid afternoon thunderstorms . eos Шар Планина , Šar Planina ; Albanian : Malet e Sharrit , Mali i Sharrit , Sharr ) is a mountain located on the southern border of Kosovo , Serbia and the northwest part of the Republic of Macedonia .

eos * Piribeg Sar_Mountain extends to Mount Korab ( 2764 m ) in the southwest , and Sar_Mountain passes into northeastern Albania . Vegetation on Sar_Mountain includes crops up to around 1000 meters , forests up to 1700 meters , and above that lie high pastures which encompass around 550 square kilometers .
eos Vegetation on Sar_Mountain includes crops up to around 1000 meters , forests up to 1700 meters , and above that lie high pastures which encompass around 550 square kilometers . Sar_Mountain is the largest compact area covered with pastures on the European continent .
eos Sar_Mountain is most known as the origin of the dog breed Šarplaninac ( Macedonian : Šarplaninec , Albanian : Qeni i Sharrit ) which was bred on these pastures . eos Saraghrar is the fourth highest independent peak in the Hindu Kush . Saraghrar is a huge , irregular stretched plateau at elevation around 7,000 m ( 22,966 ft ) , lying above vertical granite and ice faces , which protect Saraghrar all around .
